{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.05701v1", "title": "On (Some) Gauge Theories of Gravity", "summary": "I consider the sense in which teleparallel gravity and symmetric teleparallel
gravity may be understood as gauge theories of gravity. I first argue that both
theories have surplus structure. I then consider the relationship between
Yang-Mills theory and Poincare Gauge Theory and argue that though these use
similar formalisms, there are subtle disanalogies in their interpretation.", "main_category": "physics.hist-ph", "categories": "physics.hist-ph,gr-qc", "published": "2025-04-08T05:46:01Z"}
